critique: The document is a formal order to lower the flag to half-staff in memory of Fleet Admiral Ernest J. King. The primary emotion the President wants to elicit is sadness and respect. There might be a touch of surprise for those who were not expecting the announcement, but overall, the tone is somber and respectful. The language is formal and direct, indicating the importance of the order. The actions are a mark of respect, so joy and anger are not relevant. Fear and disgust are also not relevant in this context.
